title: When should I and when should I not buy Seeker's against AD Mids?
body:
Is it worth it?
Do I only do this against certain Mids?
Do I first buy it or Chalice/Needlessly LR first? (Depending on your champ's build)
Do I complete Zhonya's?

HALP.

replies.body:
always. never.

its always worth it, since it is the best defensive item to get vs ADs and burst, AND its a great offensive item for AP.
Only rush it vs AD mid or AP that arent doing anything to you with spells just auto attacks, or if you want to rush zonyas for some reason.
rush it vs AD, because it gives AR. chalice is both %%%%%%ed to get vs AD AND %%%%%%ed to get at all now because of the change to mana sustain. NLR is a good rush on high burst lvl 6 champs with decent AP ratios who dont require the defense rush. eg annie.
eventually. its only really if you need the active, like vs zed or tolan. where having the active will by far increase your survivability or kill potential.

So never buy Chalice now? I have switched to Morello's for some of my Mids like Syndra, Ahri and Liss but I still like Athene's on Ori since I feel she makes really good use of Mana Font. I don't know that probably sounded stupid but I always seem to do better with Athene's on Ori rather than Morello's on Ori.

So buy it first? I hear you and I feel like it's mandatory but then what happens to mana regen? This is why I get so annoyed when my opponent picks an AD Mid lol As one of my team's carries, I hate changing my usual build path. Bloody annoying AD Mids lolol.

And do I finish Zhonya's ALWAYS against Zed unless I'm Kayle/Lissandra?

chalice is purely a "buy if losing to magic damage and playing mana based champ" otherwise morellos trumps it for mana regen. because of the changes to the mana regen system. even then, both items are %%%%ty mana regen compared to before. expect buffs to both.
the main reason morellos is so much better is the heal reduction. its now the only item in the game that does that. and with lategame AD lifesteal from bloodthirster being off the charts %%%%%%ed (oh look, 2 auto attacks lategame and all poke is wasted. oh 10% HP? kill 1 camp in the jungle and back to full HP even tho they do tons more damage now) 
mana sustain is pushed more to self sustain by minimal usage rather than the old stack mana and mana regen and just spam. tear is by far the best choice for keeping mana high, just some champs cant stack it as efficiently as others, but overall the AAS/seraphs item is really good even before fully stacked. but doesnt offer anything but a shield when finished, whereas chalice gave the good sustain with burst mana return on kill and assist which was barely noticeable anyway, and morello with the infinitely better heal reduction. and then there is ROA, which gives everything you really need, IF you can rush it fast enough.
so in order of best to worst for mana and mana sustain regardless of enemy champion and own champion choice its ROA and AAS at = #1, morello (#1 for early sustain from base components) and lastly %%%%%%s unholy grail.
its when you start putting in which champions, full build status and reliance on CDR that morello greatly surpasses ROA, and AAS starts being slightly better than ROA and grail is still sitting about as effective as ROA overall (CDR being a highly weighted stat so that grail even comes CLOSE to ROA godlyness)

buy seakers first vs AD. there is no point not having AR vs ADs. and building MR from chalice vs zed or talon or yasuo is just asking to feed a few kills without needing to.
from there you can focus on core build. so for some champs you might want the grail (who? anivia? thats about it) or tear (much more champs would like this) and the personal best overall for CDR and mana sustain reliant champs morello. and then ofc the off shoot choice of ROA on like....a tanky annie or something that needs to survive in a fight for a bit longer than normal APCs. (swain might start tear for mana sustain and then finish a ROA, same with malz maybe)

most AD mids get lots of self sustain, either with double dorans or a mid/late game BT. so morello greatly enhances the match up to suit you better. while all they can do is get a maw to help them compete with you.

finish zonyas early vs zed sure, but it doesnt give a ton of damage boost, just 120 AP. if your champ prefers DFG, get that first then zonyas 2nd. otherwise it depends on how the match up is going, getting multiple PART components of items sometimes is ok, but mostly its not. the faster you finish 1 item the bigger your power spike will be. rabbadons gives a ton of damage, but what if zed kills you with his ult before you can even use half your combo? a zonyas would have greatly increased your fight capabilities there.

> chalice is purely a "buy if losing to magic damage and playing mana based champ" otherwise morellos trumps it for mana regen. because of the changes to the mana regen system. even then, both items are %%%%ty mana regen compared to before. expect buffs to both.
> the main reason morellos is so much better is the heal reduction. its now the only item in the game that does that.

WTF?!?! Dude Morello is an item you only buy if you're behind or need the grievous wounds passive when vsing someone like Swain or Mundo. 

Athenes is preferred over Morello in almost every situation because it gives higher mana regen, defense stats, 15% of maximum mana on assist or kill which can be game changing for teamfights without blue buff or straight up pushing a lane after a successful gank and it's only 1000g for chalice which is a really good item for early game.

go redo the maths after the change. with the otherall nerfs to mana regen morello comes out on top in most situations without buying more mana regen.
and the final item is greatly more effective in the case of vsing the AD assassins which is the reference point. "what to do vs AD mids".

pay attention before touting the OLD way without looking at the changes.

1. After like level 5 the Athenes 1.5% of missing mana regen every 5s passive + normal mana regen gives it more than Morello.
2. Morello gives no defensive stats.
3. Grievous wounds won't help against AD assassins that rely on ARM Pen and high AD to burst down targets instead of being sustain fighters hence why they are called "assassins".

You're sitting there saying I need to do the maths and pay attention but you don't even understand that Morello is a situational item for AP Supports and Mids lol.

such defence vs ADs. lifesteal is still core to their builds as it gives them sustain, either in the early game with dorans, mid game with BORK or lategame with BT.

and as i said, overall many minor inputs and variables change what is better to get. but in a double or triple AD team comp that will likely rely heavily on lifesteal sustain in situational teamfights. so overall it works out as a good item. (sure higher elo like to copy the pros who dont get lifesteal unless its a rushed bork. so its less likely to have a big impact)
but the point of fact was vs AD mids, get the parts to zonyas over rushing a chalice. and for early mana sustain getting the 600g part of morello should be enough and you arent paying for unneeded stats and delaying the mana sustain as much.

and again, its all personal preference. if you really need that 1.5% missing mana and find it efficient thats your call.

From what you're saying it seems like you've never experienced vsing an AD mid that has knowledge about how to play an AD vs AP match-up... But whatever it seems you'll never understand the points I made because of your god tier low elo mentality that makes everything you do and say 100% correct and everyone else either agrees with you or they're wrong.

you go ahead and rush chalice vs zed or yas and just get shat on. oh wait no, the laning play style of higher elo is passive enough that you can buy 2-3 completely pointless items and not worry about being constantly dived for using inefficient items.
dont get no AR/zonyas vs zed/yas. just because your cookie cutter season 3-4 build says not to get zonyas till late game.
I only said Athenes was a better buy over Morello not to rush it before Zhonyas when vsing AD lol.

tfw both Ardent Censor and Frost Queen's Claim aren't enough for your mana as Karma.

Chalice is still a very viable item for a lot of mages, and will always have a place. However, it is no longer as much of a requirement for all mages. A lot of mages are fine with just Morellonomicon now when they would have required a chalice instead.
Unfortunately, it can also be a case of testing to see what you require.

you get ardent and FQC as mid lane karma? tell me more about how that is viable....

we are talking mid laners.

also, that should be enough mana regen, but hey, supports have that really cool item that comes from chalice, so thats surely viable. mikaels.
support and mid lane mana requirements are totally different. 
but just as an example, i play ALOT of support morg annie zyra and lately a TON of vel koz. now 2 of those spam spells just to look like they are doing something, 1 uses spells at precise timings or just spams puddle for FQC stacks and lastly and most importantly 1 has to spam for damage because he lacks the utility of the others (his spamming causes utility with constant slows and a knock up but overall he is about massive damage output)
now, go check some of my match history at the builds i run on those champs. bugger all mana regen outside of FQC. i rarely go oom in teamfights, maybe after 2-3 rotations of teamfights, not of spells, WHOLE team fights. and these champs lack decent mana sustain apart from annie Q return. so why is it that these mana intensive champs dont go oom but a karma does? is it maybe because you spam abilities FAR too often? using abilities on cooldown might seem beneficial, but unless its udyr or ori there is no reason to (udyr MS and ori MS with W)

maybe check to see you arent doing something inefficiently before commenting in such a way.

Oh no, I don't use Ardent and FQC as mid. That would be horrible. That is something I tried as support. I just used that as an example about how chalice can still be required.
i mean no, i get fqc as karam mid bcuz recomened on shop :P dont tease me i jst do wat rito think i shud
Long story short is buy it if the matchup concerns you. It's particular useful against Zed to dodge death marks but even against AP mids like Fizz it's an awesome item.

Ok cool, I don't know it was never a really problem until the other day. I'm usually pretty good at dodging Zed W-Q's but the other day this Zed was hitting every single one and constantly zoning me. And the damn Shurikens were legit taking off 1/4 of my HP every time. He literally ate me alive. 2/0 and up by like 30 cs by 10 minutes..... I know right? Embarassing lol. I was playing Syndra

If their mid is pushing hard and trying to roam = Get a mana regen item first and counter push to keep them in lane or take tower.
If their mid is focusing on harassing or trying to all in whenever their full rotation is up = Get Hourglass first item so you're able to survive.

It's really good most of the time, when stacked it's gold efficient so you aren't forced into buying zhonyas as a first item if you don't want to. You might struggle if your jungler wants blue buffs though.
Ugh those guys never give me Blues. Even when I'm 4/0 and the jungler is my best friend who is due queueing with me right next to me. lolololol
